Mr* Seymour Siegel
President, NAEB
New York City, New York
Dear Si:
Your comment on my letter of December 18 to Dick concerning the Herald
Tribune forum merits further comment* I don!t know whether Dick has had a
chance to get complete reactions from all the people to whom this series was
distributed or not but we had comments from three stations besides our own
that they had not scheduled these marvelous programs* We did not have the
man hours necessary to audit them, edit them, etc* I personally feel a
great sense of loss that we were not able to schedule them and I*m sure
others had the same reaction* All of which leads me to the conclusion that
unless programs of this nature can be edited into some semblance of readiness
for broadcast, we are wasting time and money attempting to distribute them*
On the other side of the fence, when programs of this caliber are
available, I feel that our headquarters staff should make every effort to
edit them, even if it means holding them up a few days or even a couple of
weeks* Incidentally, I hope headquarters operation will keep an eagle eye
open to continue supplying the network with high caliber talk and discussion
programs* In metropolitan areas where there is an accumulation of brain
power, you aren' t faced with the problem of finding someone who can speak
brilliantly on a wide range of subjects* It is one of our problems outside
the metropolian areas, however* I should like to urge, therefore, that the
network continue to look for good talk and discussion programs to forward
to stations over the country* I should like to see more emphasis placed
on fifteen and thirty minute programs too because I feel that the hour disÂ¬
cussion or lecture program, however good, will lose a lot of people who
would stay through a good fifteen or thirty minute program*
I trust this will not be interpreted as a criticism of the network but
as a constructive statement concerning this one series and other similar
programs which we may find available in the future*
May all the good you deserve and more be yours in 1952*
